title: California State University Information Security Policy

purpose.title: Purpose and Scope
purpose.content: This policy establishes information security requirements for all California State University (CSU) campuses, employees, students, contractors, and third parties who access CSU information systems. The policy aims to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of CSU information assets while ensuring compliance with federal and state regulations.

content.Information Asset: Any data, information system, or technology resource owned, operated, or used by the CSU.
content.Sensitive Information: Information that requires protection due to legal, regulatory, contractual, or business requirements, including but not limited to personally identifiable information (PII), protected health information (PHI), financial data, and academic records.
content.Information System: Any combination of hardware, software, networks, and data used to collect, filter, process, create, store, or communicate information.
content.Authorized User: Any individual who has been granted legitimate access to CSU information systems and data.

content.minimum_length: Passwords must be at least 12 characters long
content.complexity: Passwords must contain a combination of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters
content.expiration: Passwords must be changed every 90 days for privileged accounts and every 180 days for standard user accounts
content.reuse: Users cannot reuse their last 12 passwords
content.multi_factor: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is required for all administrative accounts and recommended for all user accounts
content.storage: Passwords must not be stored in plain text or shared with others

content.public: Information that can be freely shared without risk to the CSU
content.internal: Information intended for use within the CSU community
content.confidential: Sensitive information that could cause harm if disclosed inappropriately
content.restricted: Highly sensitive information requiring the highest level of protection
content.handling_requirements: All data must be classified according to its sensitivity level and handled according to established procedures. Confidential and restricted data must be encrypted both in transit and at rest.

content.reporting: All suspected security incidents must be reported immediately to the campus IT Security Office and the CSU Information Security Office
content.response_time: Initial response to security incidents must begin within 2 hours of detection
content.documentation: All security incidents must be documented with details of the incident, response actions taken, and lessons learned
content.notification: Affected parties and regulatory bodies must be notified according to legal and policy requirements

content.principle: Access to information systems and data must be granted based on the principle of least privilege
content.authorization: All access must be authorized by the appropriate data owner or system administrator
content.review: User access rights must be reviewed at least annually and immediately upon role changes or termination
content.guest_access: Guest and temporary access must be limited in scope and duration with appropriate oversight

content.requirements: All CSU community members must comply with this policy and related procedures
content.training: Security awareness training is required annually for all users
content.violations: Policy violations may result in disciplinary action, including termination of employment or academic dismissal
content.monitoring: CSU reserves the right to monitor information systems for security and compliance purposes
